note.p: American physician, botanist, and educator. AB, Amherst College, 1860; MD, Harvard, 1863. Practised medicine in Portland, Maine. Took part in the scientific survey of Maine and published on the survey’s botanical discoveries, 1862–3. Visited areas of botanical interest in California, 1866; in Europe, 1867. Professor, Bowdoin College, 1868. From 1870, studied botany with Asa Gray. Assistant professor, vegetable physiology, Harvard, 1873; professor of botany, 1878; director of the botanic garden, 1879; Fisher Professor of natural history, 1888–1909.
